author: Special Correspondent
text:
Kanagaraj (60), a farmer from V Kaliapuram in Pollachi near Anamalai, was sentenced to life term by the Mahila Court on charges of having stabbed his wife to death and leaving his son injured with stab injuries.

According to Public Prosecutor R. Sarojini, Kanagaraj was arrested by the Anamalai police on the charges of stabbing his wife to death in a fit of rage and attacking his son, on September 7, 2013, over a heated argument. It is learnt that the accused turned alcoholic and was furious over his wife and son buying a land in their names, which led to a tussle.

The police registered a case against Kanagaraj under Section 302 (murder) and 324 (causing grievous injury) and imprisoned him. The court on Thursday found him guilty of all the charges and sentenced him to undergo a life term for the charge of murder and to a pay a fine of Rs. 5,000.

Failure to pay would result in another six months of imprisonment. For the charge of causing grievous hurt, the court awarded three years rigorous imprisonment and a fine of Rs. 2,000.

However, the accused would serve the sentences concurrently, the court said.
title: Man sentenced to life term for murdering wife
